text.section:
The Department may issue a written complaint if the Department has reasonable grounds to believe that the person to whom the complaint is directed has violated:
This subtitle;
Any rule or regulation adopted under this subtitle; or
Any sediment control plan approved under this subtitle.

After or concurrently with service of a complaint under this subtitle, the Department may:
Issue an order that requires the person to whom the order is directed to take corrective action within a time set in the order;
Send a written notice that requires the person to whom the notice is directed to file a written report about the alleged violation; or
Send a written notice that requires the person to whom the notice is directed:
To appear at a hearing before the Department at a time and place the Department sets to answer the charges in the complaint; or
To file a written report and also appear at a hearing before the Department at a time and place the Department sets to answer the charges in the complaint.
Any order issued under this section is effective immediately, according to its terms, when it is served.
